* Computational studies demonstrate that cyanosuccinic anhydride reactions proceed by a Mannich-like mechanism via the enol tautomer of the anhydride.
* The authors explored Mannich-type reactions and related 4CRs of variously substituted anhydrides, including sulfone-substituted anhydrides.
* Multigram-scale syntheses of sulfone-substituted anhydrides were achieved from readily available starting materials.
* The anhydride Mannich reaction (AMR) of sulfone-substituted anhydrides with imines formed β-lactams in high yields with only the anti diastereomer detectable.
* Methyl-substituted anhydrides provided trisubstituted γ-lactams in high yields with good diastereomeric ratios.
* The AMR was applied to a formal synthesis of (±)-isoretronecanol in six steps.
* The stereochemical outcome of the reactions is explained by a cyclic transition state stabilized by hydrogen bonding to the sulfone.
* The authors successfully synthesized various sulfone-substituted β- and γ-lactams in good yields with high diastereoselectivities (>95:5) by the anhydride Mannich reaction.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 5 bullet points:

<summary>
• The expression levels of miR-125a, miR-206, and miR-145 were lower in breast cancer tissues compared to normal tissues, while miR-21 and miR-10b levels were higher in breast cancer tissues.
• miR-145 expression was negatively correlated with tumor size and lymph node metastasis, while miR-21 was associated with older age, lymph node metastasis, and HER2-positive status.
• miR-125a and miR-21 may be significant for developing anti-HER2 drugs and overcoming herceptin resistance.
• miR-145 and miR-206 were related to negative ER and HER2 status and could be targets for treating triple-negative breast cancer.
• These miRNAs are potential novel tumor markers for breast cancer diagnosis and prognosis, and may contribute to guiding chemotherapy treatment.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 7 bullet points:

<summary>
• TGM2 mRNA and protein are overexpressed by mononuclear leukocytes, predominantly activated monocytes, in rat renal allografts on day 9 after transplantation, with lower levels on day 42.
• TGM2 mRNA expression was also induced in allograft tissue, but no quantitative changes were detected at the protein level.
• Graft monocytes were identified as strongly TGM2-immunopositive, but did not express the M2 macrophage marker CD163.
• Levels of activated caspase-3 correlated with TGM2 expression in perfusate cells, suggesting TGM2 expression may be linked to apoptosis.
• TGM2 was detected in the cytoplasm of graft blood monocytes and in the surrounding blood plasma.
• Chronic application of the transglutaminase inhibitor cystamine for 4 weeks after transplantation did not prevent development of chronic allograft injury.
• This is the first study to demonstrate TGM2 expression by monocytes activated in vivo during a reversible acute rejection episode, potentially contributing to reversion of rejection through induction of apoptosis.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
* Endothelial microparticles (EMPs) were produced from stimulated endothelial cells and characterized using flow cytometry and transmission electron microscopy.
* EMPs were introduced into a model patient IV bag connected to a continuous veno-venous hemofiltration (CVVH) circuit to test EMP removal via dialysis.
* EMP levels declined rapidly during dialysis, with 50% clearance in the first 30 minutes and levels reduced to 29% of starting concentration by 40 minutes.
* Low EMP levels in the dialysate suggest that EMP sequestration occurs within the CVVH filter or tubing and is a saturable phenomenon.
* The experimental conditions achieved the same plasma level of EMPs seen in human clinical disease.
* Limitations of the model include the relative volume differences between human circulation and the CVVH circuit compared to the model, and the absence of convection, pressure gradient forces, and in vivo EMP interactions.
* More efficient and selective EMP clearance could be achieved by using specialty CVVH filters with conjugated endothelium-specific antibodies.
* Clinical data support the protective role of CVVH in acute lung injury (ALI) management, potentially by targeting both molecular machinery and iatrogenic components.
* Future steps include assaying patients pre- and post-dialysis to observe EMP concentration effects and applying dialysis to rodent models of EMP-induced ALI.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points:

<summary>
* Optimal medical therapy, including anti-anginal agents and aggressive risk factor modification, is as effective as revascularization in reducing adverse coronary events in patients with stable angina.
* This study evaluated the effect of sublingual nitroglycerin spray on exercise tolerance in patients with chronic stable angina.
* 51 patients were randomized to receive either placebo or nitroglycerin spray (0.2 mg, 0.4 mg, 0.8 mg, or 1.6 mg) before exercise tolerance testing.
* Nitroglycerin spray significantly increased time to onset of angina and moderate angina compared to placebo in a dose-dependent manner.
* Adverse events like headache and dizziness were more frequent at higher nitroglycerin doses but were mild to moderate in severity.
* The nearly 1-minute improvement in exercise duration with nitroglycerin may translate to greater increases in angina-free walking time during daily activities.
* Studies comparing optimal medical therapy to revascularization for stable angina have shown no significant differences in rates of death or myocardial infarction.
* Sublingual nitroglycerin spray as part of optimal medical therapy can improve exercise tolerance and should be considered before referring stable angina patients for revascularization.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points:

<summary>
* Fungi like Candida albicans can cause failures in root canal treatments and are present in 20% of failed endodontic treatments.
* Mineral trioxide aggregate (MTA) is a root-end filling material with excellent properties including antimicrobial effects.
* This in vitro study compared the antifungal properties of ProRoot MTA and MTA-Angelus against C. albicans at different concentrations and time points.
* The materials were tested in freshly mixed and set states, and antifungal activity was assessed using the tube-dilution susceptibility test.
* Both ProRoot MTA and MTA-Angelus were ineffective against C. albicans at 1 hour but eliminated the fungus by 24 hours.
* The antifungal activity is likely due to the presence of calcium hydroxide and increased pH from the release of hydroxyl ions.
* The results were similar for both materials at concentrations of 50 and 100 mg/ml in fresh and set states.
* Further clinical studies are needed to investigate the effect of these materials on bacteria and fungi in vivo.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
* Stroke patients often have motor and sensory deficits on the side contralateral to the damaged hemisphere, but there is increasing evidence of subtle motor deficits on the ipsilateral side as well.
* The reasons for ipsilateral motor deficits are still unclear, but they may be due to disrupted counterbalance of each hemisphere, dysfunction of the uncrossed corticospinal tract, or different roles of both sides in hemispheric functions.
* This study investigated the presence of motor and sensory deficits in the ipsilateral upper limb of stroke patients using a tracking task and joint reposition sense test.
* 50 hemiparetic stroke patients and 40 sex- and age-matched controls participated in the study.
* The stroke group showed significantly lower accuracy on the tracking task and higher reposition errors compared to the control group, indicating ipsilateral motor and sensory deficits.
* There was a significant negative correlation between the motor and sensory deficits in stroke patients.
* Bilateral hemisphere activation during unilateral upper limb tasks and disturbance of transcallosal transfer after unilateral brain damage may explain the ipsilateral motor and sensory deficits.
* The findings suggest that both motor and sensory deficits affect the performance of the ipsilateral upper limb in stroke patients.
* Further research is needed to determine the recovery of ipsilateral sensory deficits after stroke onset and the effects of lesion location and extent of damage.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 2 bullet points:

<summary>
* The authors developed a post-coupling methodology to attach integrin-targeting RGD peptide ligands to nanoparticle surfaces in a controlled manner, in order to enable integrin receptor-mediated cellular uptake of the nanoparticles while minimizing non-specific uptake.
* Experiments with the RGD-targeted nanoparticles, using appropriate controls, demonstrated successful integrin-specific delivery to cells expressing the integrin receptors, suggesting this methodology could be applicable to other nanoparticle platforms for receptor-mediated delivery if key biophysical parameters are optimized.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
* The Millennium Cohort is the largest prospective study using primary data collection ever undertaken by the Department of Defense, which began in 2001 to evaluate data on health, behavioral risk factors, and occupational characteristics related to military service that may be associated with adverse health outcomes.
* The study included 77,047 participants at baseline, with approximately 71% responding to follow-up surveys in 2004 and 2007.
* Incident diabetes was the outcome of interest, and eligible participants were followed until the outcome was reported or until their last completed follow-up if the outcome was not reported.
* Three sleep variables were included in the analyses: trouble sleeping, sleep duration, and sleep apnea.
* Mental health conditions such as PTSD, depression, anxiety, and panic were assessed using validated questionnaires.
* Univariate and multivariable analyses using generalized estimating equations were conducted to assess associations of incident diabetes with sleep, military, demographic, behavioral, and mental health characteristics.
* Results showed that trouble sleeping, sleep duration ≤5 hours, and sleep apnea were significantly associated with higher odds of incident diabetes, independent of known risk factors and mental health conditions.
* Military service characteristics such as no deployment, enlisted pay grade, and having separated from the military were also associated with higher diabetes risk.
* The study concludes that sleep characteristics predict higher diabetes risk, independent of multiple risk factors and mental health conditions, and confirmation of these findings may advance understanding of diabetes pathophysiology and create new opportunities for prevention.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
* The study retrospectively reviewed the radiological and clinical findings of 13 children with pathologically confirmed mesenchymal hamartoma of the liver over a 15-year period.
* Based on CT scans, the tumors were classified into three types: multiseptated cystic (31%), mixed solid and cystic (38%), and solid (31%). Ultrasound and histological findings for each type were described.
* A mesenchymal hamartoma can show a wide spectrum of radiological features in children, ranging from a multiseptated cystic tumor to a mixed solid and cystic tumor, and even a completely solid tumor.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
* Studies estimate the prevalence of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in Italy to be around 0.5%, with higher rates in women and older age groups. The prevalence and costs of RA in Italy are expected to rise due to the aging population.
* The economic burden of RA in Italy includes direct medical costs, direct nonmedical costs, and indirect costs from lost productivity. Indirect costs account for a large portion of the total costs, which increase as the disease progresses.
* The introduction of costly biological agents has increased direct medical costs but is associated with improvements in disease activity, joint damage, productivity, and a reduced risk of cardiovascular events. Cost-effectiveness analyses should consider the long-term effects of drugs on disease progression and social costs.
* Comorbidities such as depression, asthma, and cardiovascular disease are common in RA patients and contribute to the economic burden. Effective management of RA and associated comorbidities through costly interventions may spare future expenses for the Italian national health care system.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
• A 71-year-old male patient with oral submucous fibrosis and reduced mouth opening of 2.5 cm was treated with sectional maxillary and mandibular final impression procedures, followed by fabricating maxillary hinged and mandibular sectional and hinged complete dentures.
• The dentures were fabricated using various techniques such as sectional impression trays, press buttons to join the sections, and orthodontic molar tubes with stainless steel wire to create hinge assemblies.
• While the technique has advantages such as simplified design and ease of fabrication, it also has disadvantages common to all sectional designs, such as additional time, labor, and materials; periodic recall, maintenance, and design improvements are needed to determine long-term success.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 7 bullet points:

<summary>
• Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) is a common and deadly cancer that disproportionately affects developing countries and males. Risk factors include chronic liver inflammation, alcohol use, and genetic metabolic diseases.
• HCC is driven by complex molecular alterations in multiple signaling pathways, including the hepatocyte growth factor (HGF) and cellular MET (cMET) pathway, which promotes cell survival, proliferation, migration, and invasion.
• Dysregulation of the HGF-cMET axis occurs in many cancers, including HCC, through mechanisms such as overexpression of HGF and cMET, constitutive kinase activation, and cMET gene mutations.
• Pharmacologic cMET inhibition is a promising therapeutic strategy for HCC. Inhibitors include biologic antagonists, cMET adaptor protein inhibitors, small-molecule downstream pathway inhibitors, and small synthetic MET tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs).
• Promising results in phase 2 trials for HCC have been reported for the MET TKIs tivantinib and cabozantinib. Tivantinib improved overall survival and time to progression in patients with high MET expression.
• Identifying predictive biomarkers is important for selecting patients most likely to benefit from cMET inhibitors. Strategies include assessing tumor cMET expression, MET sequence status, and pharmacodynamic serum markers.
• Challenges in developing cMET inhibitors for HCC include acquired and primary resistance mechanisms. Combination therapy, enriched patient cohorts, and incorporation of biomarker analyses in clinical trials are essential moving forward.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 2 bullet points:

<summary>
• Recent studies have suggested potential associations between diabetes, insulin therapy (particularly the insulin analog glargine), and increased cancer risk, but the evidence is inconclusive and controversial, with some studies finding no increased risk.
• While the studies raise concerns, experts agree that current evidence does not warrant changes in clinical practice regarding insulin use, and further research is needed to clarify the complex relationships between diabetes, insulin therapy, and cancer risk.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 7 bullet points:

<summary>
* Adamantinoma of the tibia is a rare, slow-growing primary bone tumor with approximately 300 reported cases in the English literature. 15-20% develop metastases, most commonly to the lungs.
* There is controversy regarding the origins of adamantinoma and its relationship to osteofibrous/fibrous dysplasia. The authors report 2 problematic cases from a diagnostic perspective.
* Case 1 is a 29-year-old female with tibial adamantinoma that metastasized to the inguinal lymph nodes, initially misdiagnosed as a cutaneous adnexal carcinoma. Case 2 is a 58-year-old female with tibial adamantinoma initially misdiagnosed as fibrous dysplasia.
* Adamantinoma can be divided into classical and differentiated types based on histology and biological behavior. Classical adamantinoma occurs in an older age group and has a higher risk of recurrence and metastasis.
* Distant metastases occur in 15-20% of cases, more frequently in patients with repeated local recurrences due to inadequate primary treatment. Risk factors include male sex, persistent pain, short symptom duration, and inadequate initial treatment.
* Early metastases within 2 years commonly involve regional lymph nodes, while delayed metastases are usually pulmonary or osseous. Surgical excision is recommended for localized regional lymph node metastases.
* Increased clinical awareness of uncommon metastatic patterns in this rare neoplasm is essential for accurate diagnosis and optimal management. Long-term follow-up is recommended due to the slow-growing nature of tibial adamantinomas.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 5 bullet points:

<summary>
* ZnO nanowhiskers (NWs) grown on CZ silicon solar cells using a low-cost aqueous solution method can effectively reduce reflectivity (R < 3%) over a large spectral region and improve external quantum efficiency.
* The density and length of ZnO NWs can be controlled by the growth time, with optimal growth time being 45 minutes.
* ZnO NWs grown for 45 minutes improved solar cell efficiency by 3% due to increased short-circuit current density and fill factor.
* The antireflection properties of ZnO NWs result from light trapping by multiple scattering and a gradually changing refractive index profile.
* Prolonged immersion of solar cells in the aqueous growth solution can deteriorate solar cell performance.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
* Hyperhidrosis is a condition that causes excessive sweating, affecting 0.6-1.0% of the population, and can significantly decrease quality of life.
* Various treatment options are available, but video-assisted thoracoscopic sympathetic surgery is globally accepted for treating primary palmar hyperhidrosis.
* This study compared the efficacy and adverse effects of two simplified surgical methods: transecting the sympathetic chain at either the third (R3) or fourth (R4) rib.
* 133 patients with primary hyperhidrosis underwent video-assisted thoracic sympathicotomy between 1999 and 2009.
* All operations were successfully performed without severe complications, and there was no significant difference in satisfaction rate and recurrence between the R3 and R4 groups.
* The incidence of "moderate" to "severe" compensatory sweating was higher in the R3 group (71.8%) than the R4 group (33%).
* Factors such as sympathicotomy level, surgical procedures, and patient conditions can influence the severity of compensatory sweating.
* Selective sympathicotomy, particularly at the R4 level, is an effective method to reduce compensatory sweating while maintaining efficacy in treating hyperhidrosis.
* R4 sympathicotomy should be the method of choice for treating palmar and axillary hyperhidrosis, as it decreases side effects without compromising efficacy compared to R3 sympathicotomy.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points:

<summary>
* Parkinson's disease (PD) is characterized by degeneration of dopaminergic and nondopaminergic neurons and can be challenging to differentiate from other neurodegenerative parkinsonian syndromes (non-PD) like multiple system atrophy (MSA) and progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP).
* Dopamine transporter (DAT) SPECT imaging can help support a diagnosis of degenerative parkinsonian syndromes but cannot differentiate PD from non-PD with sufficient accuracy alone.
* Meta-[123I]-iodobenzylguanidine (MIBG) myocardial scintigraphy assesses sympathetic cardiac nerve terminals and shows decreased cardiac MIBG uptake in PD compared to other parkinsonian syndromes, but is insufficient alone for distinguishing PD from non-PD.
* This retrospective study compared striatal DAT SPECT and myocardial MIBG scintigraphy results with clinical diagnoses in 34 patients with suspected parkinsonian syndromes to evaluate the diagnostic accuracy of combined SPECT imaging.
* The sensitivity and specificity of the delayed heart-to-mediastinum (H/M) ratio on MIBG scintigraphy for differentiating PD from non-PD were 93% and 47% respectively, while those of the specific binding ratio (SBR) on DAT SPECT were 86.7% and 52.6% respectively.
* The combined use of DAT SPECT and MIBG scintigraphy using cutoff values of SBR < 3.24 and delayed H/M ratio < 2.745 distinguished PD from non-PD with a sensitivity of 86.7%, specificity of 73.7%, and accuracy of 79.4%.
* Limitations of the study include the small sample size from a single center, lack of histopathological confirmation of diagnoses, and the need to establish appropriate withdrawal periods for interfering drugs before molecular examinations.
* The combination of DAT SPECT and MIBG myocardial scintigraphy may

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
• A 73-year-old Korean man presented with a perianal nodule caused by infestation with an Amblyomma testudinarium tick, which he likely acquired while defecating outdoors near a water reservoir in southwestern South Korea.
• Histopathologic examination of the tick bite site revealed an intense skin reaction with inflammatory infiltrate through all skin layers, a feeding lesion beneath the attachment site, and a paucicellular zone around the lesion possibly due to anti-inflammatory effects of tick saliva.
• The tick was identified as an adult female A. testudinarium based on morphological characteristics. This case extends the known geographic range of this tick species in South Korea.
• As a longirostrate tick, A. testudinarium has long mouthparts that penetrate deeply into the dermis and secrete eosinophilic cement mostly in the perirostral portion to help attach to the host during feeding.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
• The study identified three reported mutations and one new mutation of the TNNT2 gene in 11 individuals from four Japanese families with familial hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM).
• The phenotypes of each family often differed from reported cases, even with the same genetic mutation. Families with the same mutation showed similar phenotype trends but were not exactly the same.
• Sudden death in youth was observed in all of the families studied, regardless of the specific TNNT2 mutation.
• The authors conclude that in Japanese familial HCM, the type of TNNT2 mutation alone does not seem useful in predicting prognosis, but the presence of a mutation indicates a risk of sudden death in youth. Detailed observation of patients from birth in each family is important.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
• Schistosoma species are parasitic flatworms that cause the neglected tropical disease schistosomiasis. Genome and transcriptome sequencing of several Schistosoma species has provided valuable insights into the biology and evolution of these important parasites.
• Comparative genomic and phylogenetic analyses have revealed the evolutionary relationships among Schistosoma species and other platyhelminths, supporting an Asian origin of the genus. Transcriptomic studies have uncovered genes and pathways involved in development, host-parasite interactions, and sexual dimorphism.
• Despite progress, challenges remain in fully understanding the complex biology of schistosomes. Integration of genomic, transcriptomic, and proteomic data, as well as advances in functional genomic tools like RNAi and transgenesis, will be crucial for developing new interventions to combat schistosomiasis.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 2 bullet points:

<summary>
* For patients with synchronous colorectal liver metastases (SCLM), simultaneous resection of the primary colorectal tumor and liver metastases is a favorable strategy, but the optimal surgical approach remains controversial due to concerns about higher morbidity compared to staged resections.
* This retrospective study found that the morbidity rate and frequency of anastomotic leakage were high with simultaneous resection for SCLM, especially in patients with greater intraoperative blood loss or operation time greater than 8 hours, suggesting that staged resections should be considered when simultaneous resection would involve excessive surgical stress.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points:

<summary>
• The study aimed to validate two scores for assessing patients' ability to use metered dose inhalers (MDIs) or dry powder inhalers (DPIs), identify common errors, and determine which patients need training.
• The study was conducted in three phases: validating score reliability, assessing content validity, and assessing criterion and discriminant validity in eligible patients.
• The most common error for both inhalers was not maintaining total lung capacity after deep inhalation. More errors were made with MDIs than DPIs.
• Validated scores showed high interobserver correlation and agreement in classifying patients as able/unable to use inhalers correctly.
• The validated scores allow identification and correction of inhaler technique errors during visits and improvement of inhaler use.
• Previous studies have validated MDI scores in asthma patients and DPI scores in COPD patients, but this study validated both in asthma patients.
• Limitations include lack of follow-up to assess improvement and high error rates with MDIs, suggesting a need for repeated assessment.
• Correct inhaler technique is essential for effective pharmacological treatment, and the validated scores enable health professionals to identify and correct errors to improve inhaler use.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
* Enterocin S37 is a bacteriocin produced by Enterococcus faecalis S37 isolated from chicken feces that exhibits antimicrobial activity against Listeria monocytogenes and Campylobacter jejuni.
* Enterocin S37 was purified and characterized as a small (<10 kDa), heat-stable, pH-tolerant, protease-sensitive peptide, likely belonging to class IIa bacteriocins.
* The mode of action of enterocin S37 involves interaction with the cell membrane and depletion of intracellular K+ ions via K-ATP channels, as evidenced by the effects of K+ channel modulators on its activity against sensitive and resistant L. monocytogenes strains.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
* The trials were conducted in compliance with ethical guidelines and received institutional review board approval, with informed consent obtained from participants.
* The phase 1 study assessed the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of a single intrathecal dose of nusinersen in children with spinal muscular atrophy.
* 28 medically stable children aged 2-14 years with spinal muscular atrophy types 2 and 3 were enrolled across 4 U.S. sites.
* 3 lumbar punctures were scheduled for drug delivery and cerebrospinal fluid collection, using 22-25 gauge spinal needles at the L3-L4 disc space.
* Anesthesia and imaging guidance were used to facilitate the procedures at the discretion of the investigators.
* Adverse events related to lumbar puncture occurred in 32% of procedures, most commonly headache, back pain, and post-lumbar puncture syndrome, which resolved without long-term complications.
* Adverse events were more frequent with larger needle sizes (21-22 gauge), in older children (8-14 years), and in those with spinal muscular atrophy type 3.
* Conservative treatment with bed rest, hydration, caffeine, and analgesics was sufficient to resolve post-lumbar puncture headache/syndrome without requiring blood patches.
* The study concluded that intrathecal delivery of nusinersen is feasible, safe, and well-tolerated in children with spinal muscular atrophy, and provided guidance for best practices.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 10 bullet points:

<summary>
* Senior managers in Iran believe that sufficient knowledge, clear understanding, supporting culture, appropriate organizational structure, and managerial commitment are key facilitators for implementing clinical governance (CG).
* Main barriers identified were lack of adequate managerial support, resources, structural and cultural issues, and professional boundaries.
* The domains affecting CG implementation were knowledge and attitude, culture, organizational factors, managerial factors, and barriers.
* Culture was considered an important factor, with organizations shaping their culture to improve quality through a sense of ownership and positive attitudes.
* Meaningful engagement and commitment at all levels, especially among physicians and medical staff, was highlighted as a major factor.
* Top management support was frequently cited as imperative for success, while resistance from managers was a consistent barrier.
* Employee recognition, rewards, and adequate salaries were relatively important factors for staff involvement.
* Lack of resources, improper planning, incompatible organizational structure, and inadequate teamwork were additional barriers.
* Senior managers recommended creating a suitable culture, evaluating organizational quality, setting strategic plans, following programs, evaluating results, and encouraging continuous quality improvement.
* Developing educational courses, supportive culture, staff commitment, effective communication, clinical guidelines, incentives, and overcoming legal challenges were proposed solutions for successful CG implementation.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
• Hydatid cyst disease, caused by the larval stage of Echinococcus granulosus, is a significant zoonotic disease transmitted between canines, herbivores, and humans, with Iran being a hyper-endemic area.
• In a cross-sectional study in Khorasan Razavi province, Iran from 2011-2014, 357 hydatid cyst cases were registered, with the highest percentages in Mashhad, Ghoochan, Neishabour, and Fariman.
• The majority of patients were women, rural residents, housewives, infected with a single cyst, and diagnosed by radiology or CT scan, with liver being the most common localization.
• Risk factors included contact with dogs and improper washing of vegetables, highlighting the need for improved education and awareness of the disease, its symptoms, and infection sources among high-risk populations.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points:

<summary>
* Ciliated hepatic foregut cysts (CHFCs) are rare congenital cysts first described by Friederich in 1857, with only 103 cases reported in the last 150 years.
* CHFCs are characterized by 4 typical layers: pseudostratified columnar epithelium with mucus cells, subepithelial connective tissue, smooth muscle, and an outer fibrous capsule.
* CHFCs are thought to originate from abnormal embryological development of the foregut and are most commonly found in segment IV of the liver.
* Imaging features of CHFCs are variable; they can appear as anechoic or hypoechoic cysts on ultrasound and as non-enhancing lesions on CT.
* Histologically, CHFCs must be differentiated from other hepatic cysts like simple cysts, hydatid cysts, biliary cystadenomas, cystadenocarcinomas, and bronchogenic cysts.
* Treatment of CHFCs ranges from observation to aspiration to surgical excision, with excision recommended for cysts larger than 4-5 cm, symptomatic or enlarging lesions, and cysts with wall abnormalities on imaging.
* Laparoscopic excision is well-suited for CHFCs due to their small size, anterior subcapsular location, benign nature, and thick cyst wall.
* The rarity of CHFCs underscores the importance of reporting individual cases, and laparoscopic excision should be considered as a first-line treatment for these benign cysts.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
• Orally dissolving strips are an advanced oral solid dosage form that dissolves in the mouth within a minute without chewing or water, providing quick absorption and instant bioavailability.
• Clobazam, an antiepileptic drug, was formulated as an orally dissolving strip using PVA as the film former and SSG as the disintegrant in a 3^2 factorial design.
• FTIR and DSC studies showed no interaction between clobazam and the polymers used. Physicochemical characterization indicated the strips were uniform with neutral surface pH.
• Increasing PVA increased disintegration time and tensile strength, while increasing SSG decreased disintegration time and increased drug release. Formulation F6 with 100 mg PVA and 6% SSG showed the best properties.
• In vitro drug release from the optimized strip (F6) was comparable to the marketed tablet formulation (Frisium 5). Both followed Higuchi diffusion-controlled release kinetics.
• SEM revealed a smooth strip surface with uniform drug distribution. The optimized strip was stable for at least 6 months at 40°C/75% RH.
• In vivo studies in rabbits showed no significant difference in pharmacokinetic parameters between the optimized strip and marketed tablets. The formulations were bioequivalent.
• A good in vitro-in vivo correlation (r=0.994) was established for the percentage of drug released in vitro and absorbed in vivo for formulation F6.
• The developed clobazam orally dissolving strip is a potentially useful alternative to tablets for epilepsy treatment, offering improved patient compliance and convenience.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 10 bullet points:

<summary>
* This systematic review examined the methodological quality of studies determining the psychometric properties of outcome measures used in stroke self-management interventions (SMIs).
* 43 different outcome measures were used in the stroke SMI studies reviewed, suggesting a lack of consensus on appropriate measures to evaluate these interventions.
* None of the studies measured stroke self-management as a discrete concept; instead measures focused on physical function, mood, quality of life, and health behaviors/attitudes.
* 49% of measures demonstrated some psychometric properties in stroke populations based on the COSMIN checklist criteria.
* Many studies used unreported measures developed by the authors with unknown reliability and validity in stroke populations.
* Only 3 measures (SA-SIP30, SSEQ, SIPSO) scored "excellent" for content validity by including input from the target population in their development.
* Most measures scored "fair" or "poor" on the COSMIN criteria, partly due to inadequate sample sizes used in the validation studies.
* The theoretical premises of stroke SMIs are unclear and rarely explicitly stated, making it difficult to select appropriate outcome measures.
* Further research is needed to conceptualize stroke self-management and identify or develop valid outcome measures that align with this concept.
* Researchers and clinicians should use measures with established reliability and validity in stroke populations and that were developed with input from the target population.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points:

<summary>
* The study examined the correlation between the Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) questionnaire and objective measures like the 6-minute walk test (6-MWT), age, height, weight, and BMI in Indian patients with knee osteoarthritis.
* The KOOS sports and recreation subscale had the lowest mean score, followed by the quality of life (QOL) subscale.
* The 6-MWT had weak to very strong correlations with the KOOS subscales, with the strongest correlation being with KOOS-QOL.
* BMI had strong to very strong correlations with all KOOS subscales, while weight had weak to strong correlations.
* Age had no significant correlation with any KOOS subscales except a weak correlation with KOOS-QOL.
* The study results confirm the usefulness of the KOOS questionnaire in Indian knee osteoarthritis patients and are consistent with previous studies.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
* A high-fat diet combined with ovariectomy in rats promoted increased body weight gain, food efficiency, carcass lipid content, and serum leptin levels compared to sham-operated rats.
* The high-fat diet decreased IL-6 and IL-10 levels in mesenteric and retroperitoneal adipose tissues, while ovariectomy combined with the high-fat diet decreased TNF-α, IL-6, and IL-10 in mesenteric adipose tissue.
* Protein levels of IL-6 receptor, TNF receptor, TLR-4, and MyD88 were similar between groups in liver, gastrocnemius muscle, and mesenteric adipose tissues.
* The results suggest that after menopause, women should decrease fat consumption to avoid potential proinflammatory effects associated with the combination of estrogen deficiency and a high-fat diet.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
• Bronchial artery embolization (BAE) is a safe and effective treatment for controlling massive, chronic, or recurrent hemoptysis, with a 96% immediate success rate in this study of 344 patients.
• The main causes of hemoptysis were tuberculosis (55.2%), bronchiectasis (28.8%), and malignancy (5.8%).
• The most common responsible arteries were the right bronchial artery, left bronchial artery, combined right and left bronchial trunk, and right intercostal arteries.
• Complications of BAE included fever, chest pain, shoulder pain, and groin hematoma, which typically resolved within 48 hours.
• Recurrent bleeding occurred in 17.7% of patients within 30 days and 21.5% after 1 month, often requiring repeat embolization.
• In the long-term follow-up (6 months to 8 years), 28 patients died, with 6 deaths due to massive hemorrhage. 21 patients had recurrent hemoptysis controlled with medication.
• BAE represents the first-line treatment for hemoptysis from bronchial arteries, and can be repeated as needed.
• Over 50% of patients had massive hemoptysis, about 70% had no identifiable bleeding point on CT, and 41% had bilateral sources on angiography.
• While the long-term prognosis is poor for some patients, BAE may be the only life-saving option for those who are not surgical candidates.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
• Celiac disease (CD) and Helicobacter pylori (HP) infection are two common causes of lymphocytic gastritis (LG) in children, characterized by increased intraepithelial lymphocytes (IELs) in the gastric mucosa.
• The study found the highest prevalence of LG in pediatric CD patients without HP infection, followed by CD patients with HP infection, and HP infected patients without CD.
• CD patients had significantly higher numbers of CD3+ and CD8+ IELs compared to controls and HP infected patients without CD, suggesting CD8+ IELs may help differentiate CD from HP gastritis in cases of LG.
• The highest number of lymphoid follicles was observed in HP positive children regardless of CD status, indicating follicle count may point toward HP infection in undefined cases of CD versus HP gastritis.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
• Angiogenesis, the formation of new blood vessels, is required for solid tumor growth and is stimulated by vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), which binds to VEGF receptors (VEGFR1 and VEGFR2).
• Inhibition of angiogenesis using drugs that target VEGF could be an important tool in cancer treatment due to low toxicity and avoiding attack on cancer cells directly.
• In breast cancer, elevated VEGF levels are associated with poor prognosis. Anti-VEGF therapy with bevacizumab, 2C3 or R84 antibodies inhibits breast tumor growth in mice.
• Inhibition of VEGF binding to VEGFR2 is sufficient to reduce tumor size in pancreatic and breast tumors. In vitro, breast cancer cell migration is blocked by anti-VEGF antibodies.
• In a mouse model of breast cancer, anti-VEGF therapy reduced tumor microvessel density and infiltration of macrophages and other immune cells.
• Cancer and inflammation are connected by intrinsic and extrinsic pathways that activate transcription factors, leading to production of inflammatory mediators and a cancer-related inflammatory microenvironment.
• VEGF is a chemoattractant for inflammatory cells. Inhibiting VEGF reduces angiogenesis and modulates immune cell infiltration in breast cancer xenografts.
• Combining VEGF shRNA with chemotherapy had enhanced antitumor effects compared to either treatment alone in lung cancer cells.
• Several VEGF inhibitors are approved for cancer treatment. Combining angiogenesis inhibitors with chemotherapy or using them preventively may be effective strategies.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
• The REVIVE survey found that many postmenopausal women have low awareness and poor understanding of vulvar and vaginal atrophy (VVA) and its symptoms.
• Nearly half of women surveyed had never discussed VVA symptoms with a healthcare provider (HCP), often assuming symptoms were a natural part of aging.
• VVA negatively impacts women's lives, especially enjoyment of sex, and worsens over time if left untreated.
• Only 40% of women used VVA-specific treatments; many were dissatisfied with over-the-counter (OTC) products and prescription therapies due to inadequate symptom relief, inconvenience, and safety concerns.
• HCPs should proactively screen for VVA, provide patient education on physical changes and disease progression, and discuss treatment options.
• Simple screening questions during routine visits can identify women needing VVA treatment.
• Engaging women in candid discussions about symptom severity, preferences, and treatment concerns can guide appropriate treatment selection.
• OTC products do not treat underlying causes of VVA; prescription therapies like vaginal estrogens and ospemifene directly improve physical changes.
• HCPs play a key role in identifying women with VVA, providing essential education, and guiding patients to appropriate treatment to ultimately improve outcomes.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 5 bullet points:

<summary>
• In Denmark, women planning to conceive are advised to take 400 μg of folic acid (FA) daily until the 12th week of pregnancy to reduce the risk of neural tube defects, but compliance with this recommendation has been low.
• This study analyzed data from 5,383 Danish women planning pregnancy to estimate the prevalence of FA and multivitamin (MV) supplement use and identify predictors of use.
• Overall, 62.1% of women used either FA supplements, MV supplements, or both, while 37.9% did not use any FA or MV supplements.
• Higher age, education, income, intercourse frequency, having pap smears, and previous spontaneous abortion were associated with increased FA or MV use, while smoking, alcohol intake, high BMI, and low physical activity were associated with decreased use.
• The findings indicate that over one-third of pregnancy planners do not follow the FA recommendation, especially those with other risky behaviors, underscoring the need to target high-risk women with information about preconceptional guidelines.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points:

<summary>
• Peripheral arterial disease (PAD) results from narrowing of arteries in the lower extremities due to atherosclerosis and is an important predictor of coronary and cerebral vascular risk.
• The study evaluated lipid peroxidation parameters and total antioxidant capacity in the serum of PAD patients before and after surgery, and compared these to patients receiving simvastatin therapy.
• PAD patients before surgery had enhanced oxidative stress, as demonstrated by elevated serum levels of malondialdehyde (MDA), compared to those treated with simvastatin.
• Total antioxidant capacity (FRAP) and thiol (-SH) group concentrations decreased after surgery in PAD patients, while ceruloplasmin oxidase activity increased 7-10 days after surgery.
• Simvastatin therapy (20 mg daily) did not influence total antioxidant potential but was associated with lower MDA levels compared to PAD patients before surgery.
• The study confirms the beneficial effects of statin therapy in PAD and shows diverse oxidative state responses to surgical treatment.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points:

<summary>
• The demand for herbal remedies in Nigeria has been rising, but there is little scientific data on their safety and medicinal claims, such as for the herbal mixture FIJK.
• In a study, oral administration of FIJK to rats at various doses for 21 days caused significant alterations in plasma protein levels, lipid profile, liver enzymes, and markers of oxidative stress compared to controls.
• FIJK exposure elevated triglycerides, LDL cholesterol, atherogenic index, ALT, and AST, while reducing HDL cholesterol, alkaline phosphatase, and glutathione levels in rat plasma.
• FIJK increased lipid peroxidation as indicated by higher plasma malondialdehyde levels in treated rats.
• Histopathological examination of rat liver sections revealed hemorrhage, ruptured vascular channels, hyperemia, and inflammation in FIJK-treated groups but not controls.
• The study suggests oral exposure to FIJK herbal mixture may increase atherogenic risk and cause oxidative stress and liver injury in rats, highlighting the need for scientific validation of herbal remedies.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points:

<summary>
• Preconceptional carrier screening has the potential to inform prospective parents about genetic risks to future offspring and allow them to make reproductive choices, but has not been widely implemented in traditional healthcare systems due to various concerns.
• Recently, some commercial companies have begun offering preconceptional carrier tests directly to consumers, which has generated debate about the desirability and appropriateness of these services.
• Key issues with direct-to-consumer carrier testing include the large and variable number of disorders tested, the appropriateness and validity of some tests, the lack of individualized medical supervision and pre/post-test counseling, and the burden on healthcare resources for follow-up.
• Informed consent and pre/post-test counseling are critical to ensure informed decision-making but may be lacking in a commercial direct-to-consumer model.
• Embedding carrier screening within the healthcare system can help ensure adequate information provision, informed consent, medical follow-up, and psychosocial counseling.
• The expenses of preconceptional carrier screening need to be weighed against the health gain and goals of enabling reproductive choice.
• Government oversight and regulation of direct-to-consumer genetic testing services are expected to increase to ensure responsible provision and use.
• Preconceptional carrier screening should be available to enhance reproductive autonomy but requires careful implementation to optimize screening, counseling, and follow-up.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
* Pain/discomfort/prominent hardware (39.75%), infection (28.91%), and implant failure (9.52%) were the most common indications for implant removal in this study of 83 patients.
* The average age was higher for patients requiring removal due to infection (49.33 years) compared to those with pain (31.6 years) or implant failure (35 years). Males comprised 85.5% of patients.
* Implant removal carries risks of complications like fracture, nerve injury, and infection. Factors like bone ingrowth and implant wear can make removal difficult. The authors recommend against routine removal in asymptomatic patients.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points:

<summary>
* Glaucoma is characterized by loss of retinal ganglion cells (RGCs) and optic nerve atrophy. Müller cells are glial cells in the retina that support and nourish retinal neurons.
* In a rat model of acute ocular hypertension (AOH) mimicking glaucoma, α-aminoadipic acid (AAA) treatment inhibited Müller cell gliosis and protected against retinal abnormalities.
* AOH induced apoptotic death of RGCs in the ganglion cell layer. AAA treatment attenuated TUNEL-positive RGCs and rescued Thy-1-positive RGCs in the AOH model.
* Müller cell gliosis, indicated by GFAP immunoreactivity, was observed in the AOH model. AAA treatment reduced GFAP immunoreactivity across the inner plexiform layer.
* Retinal TNF-α protein levels were upregulated in the AOH model. AAA treatment attenuated the TNF-α levels.
* In the AOH model, retinal thickness in the inner plexiform and inner nuclear layers was reduced compared to control.
* Strong expression of GFAP was shown in glutamine synthetase-positive Müller cells after 5 days of AOH.
* The findings suggest AAA promotes RGC survival in the AOH model by inhibiting Müller cell gliosis and downregulating TNF-α production, indicating its potential as a therapeutic target for glaucoma.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points:

<summary>
* Endoscopic resection of superficial duodenal neoplasms (SDNs) is challenging due to high risk of severe adverse events like delayed perforation
* Laparoscopic and/or endoscopic full-thickness resection (FTR) is useful for nonampullary SDNs but has risk of intraperitoneal tumor dissemination
* The authors developed laparoscopy-assisted endoscopic full-thickness resection with ligation device (LAEFTR-L) as an alternative FTR method
* In LAEFTR-L, the duodenum is mobilized, the tumor is ligated with a ligation device, temporarily sutured, and then resected endoscopically
* The resected specimen is retrieved intraluminally to avoid peritoneal exposure to tumor cells
* The authors used LAEFTR-L to treat 5 patients with nonampullary SDNs, achieving complete resection in all cases without complications
* LAEFTR-L has advantages of avoiding intraperitoneal tumor dissemination and not requiring proficient ESD experience
* Tumor size under 15 mm and location away from the ampulla are important considerations for LAEFTR-L; further studies are needed to evaluate its efficacy and safety
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
• Congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH) is an autosomal recessive disorder most commonly caused by 21-hydroxylase deficiency, leading to cortisol and aldosterone deficiency and androgen excess.
• Classic CAH presents with ambiguous genitalia in females and adrenal crisis in males, while non-classic CAH presents later with signs of androgen excess.
• Treatment involves glucocorticoid and mineralocorticoid replacement to suppress excess androgens and normalize electrolytes.
• Patients with CAH have a higher incidence of adrenal masses, which are usually benign, and require lifelong management and monitoring.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
• Self-rated health (SRH) is a validated tool for predicting mortality and functional ability, and is associated with lifestyle behaviors such as diet and physical activity.
• In a study of a primarily Hispanic and black population in Miami-Dade County, Florida, participants with poor/fair SRH were more likely to have low fruit and vegetable intake, high fat intake, and low physical activity levels.
• Gender differences were observed, with a stronger association between poor/fair SRH and low physical activity in females compared to males.
• The results suggest that gender-specific interventions targeting modifiable lifestyle behaviors may be important for preventing cardiovascular diseases and improving SRH.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
• Endoscopic injection of dextranomer/hyaluronic acid copolymer (Dx/HA) is a minimally invasive treatment option for vesicoureteral reflux (VUR) in children, with success rates of 75-80% compared to 98% for open surgery.
• Positional instillation of contrast (PIC) cystography and high-pressure cystograms were performed intraoperatively to evaluate their ability to predict success of Dx/HA injection and detect contralateral de novo VUR.
• Intraoperative cystograms only correlated with postoperative voiding cystourethrogram (VCUG) results in 80% of cases and cannot replace postoperative studies, but PIC cystography can detect occult VUR in the contralateral ureter in unilateral cases.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 2 bullet points:

<summary>
* Fetal MRI is increasingly used as an adjunct to ultrasound for diagnosing and characterizing fetal anomalies, particularly those involving the central nervous system such as ventriculomegaly. MRI provides excellent contrast resolution and can visualize the brain in any plane without interference from the skull bones.
* MRI is especially useful for detecting additional cerebral anomalies associated with ventriculomegaly such as corpus callosum dysgenesis, cortical malformations, posterior fossa anomalies, and sequelae of congenital infections. Most studies advocate using MRI in cases of moderate and severe ventriculomegaly to confirm severity and detect additional findings that may be missed by ultrasound.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points:

<summary>
• Lung cancer is a common cancer with high mortality, often diagnosed at an advanced stage. Bone is a frequent site of metastasis, placing patients at risk for skeletal-related events (SREs) like fractures and spinal cord compression.
• This study used SEER cancer registry data linked with Medicare claims to identify bone metastasis and SREs in lung cancer patients aged 65+ diagnosed from 1999-2005. 19.8% had evidence of bone metastasis and 51% of those experienced an SRE.
• Having a bone metastasis, with or without an SRE, was associated with a 2.4-fold increased risk of death compared to no bone metastasis, after adjusting for factors like age, gender, race, cancer stage, and comorbidities.
• The association between bone metastasis and mortality was stronger for patients with localized lung cancer at diagnosis compared to those with distant stage disease.
• Limitations include the study being restricted to Medicare patients aged 65+ in SEER regions, possible missed bone metastasis cases, and lack of data on potential confounders like treatment and functional status.
• In conclusion, bone metastasis as indicated by Medicare claims was associated with increased mortality in older lung cancer patients, regardless of whether it was complicated by an SRE.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
* This study compared the effect of different smear layer removal methods, including photodynamic diode laser, on the bond strength of self-adhesive resin cement to root canal dentin when cementing fiber posts.
* The results showed that the photodynamic diode laser and 37% orthophosphoric acid groups had the highest bond strength values, while NaOCl, NaCl, and EDTA groups had lower values.
* SEM evaluation revealed that orthophosphoric acid and EDTA were more effective at removing the smear layer compared to the other methods, but the diode laser was able to improve bonding effectiveness at the cement-dentin interface without completely removing the smear layer.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points:

<summary>
* The human gut microbiome plays a crucial role in health and disease, and recent studies have begun to characterize the bacterial communities in the gastrointestinal tract.
* Gut microbiota composition is influenced by factors such as diet, environment, genetics, and maternal flora, and can impact host metabolism, adiposity, and gene expression.
* Three enterotypes of the human gut microbiome have been proposed, each with distinct bacterial compositions and functional properties, though further research is needed to validate this concept.
* Inflammatory bowel diseases like Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis are associated with gut dysbiosis, characterized by altered bacterial composition and reduced diversity.
* Innate immune receptors such as TLRs, NLRs, and NOD2 play important roles in sensing gut microbes and maintaining intestinal homeostasis, and their dysfunction can contribute to IBD pathogenesis.
* The gut microbiota influences various aspects of host physiology beyond the intestine, including liver function, glucose metabolism, and even behavior via the gut-brain axis.
* Probiotics and microbial metabolites like short-chain fatty acids may have protective effects against colitis and other gut disorders.
* Future research should focus on understanding the complex interactions between the gut microbiome, host genetics, diet, and environment in shaping health and disease.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 5 bullet points:

<summary>
* Onychomycosis is a chronic fungal nail infection caused by dermatophytes, yeasts, and nondermatophytes, with trichophyton species being the most common; risk factors include aging, diabetes, and nail psoriasis.
* Current topical treatments for onychomycosis such as amorolfine, ciclopirox, and tioconazole have limited efficacy and require long treatment durations.
* In an open observational study, topical tazarotene 0.1% gel applied daily for 12 weeks resulted in complete cure of distal and lateral subungual onychomycosis in all 15 patients.
* In vitro testing demonstrated the fungistatic activity of tazarotene against trichophyton and candida species.
* Tazarotene's efficacy in onychomycosis may be due to its ability to reduce hyperkeratosis, modulate inflammation and immunity, and exert direct fungistatic effects; further controlled studies are needed to confirm these promising results.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points:

<summary>
• In a study of 24 patients who were clinical non-responders to cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT), endocardial left ventricular (LV) pacing guided by acute hemodynamic response (AHR) improved outcomes in some patients.
• Posterolateral LV lead position was important, as clinical response improved with a posterolateral lead instead of the original apical or anterolateral location.
• Endocardial pacing opposite the coronary sinus pacing site did not improve AHR, suggesting epicardial pacing at the optimal site may be a good alternative to endocardial LV pacing.
• Some limitations were noted in using AHR to predict clinical outcomes, such as patients with positive AHR who failed to respond clinically.
• The longest time interval between QRS onset and LV sensing relative to QRS width was a reliable indicator of the optimal LV pacing site in individual patients.
• Larger randomized studies are needed to justify using AHR-guided LV endocardial pacing in CRT non-responders before definitive conclusions can be made.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 10 bullet points:

<summary>
• Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD) affects 1 in 500 to 1 in 1000 individuals and may not be apparent until the 3rd or 4th decade of life.
• Complications in pregnant ADPKD patients undergoing dialysis include hypertension, preeclampsia, anemia, infected cysts, and risk of cerebral artery aneurysm rupture.
• A 35-year-old primigravida with ADPKD was scheduled for emergency cesarean section after being hospitalized and dialyzed for 2 months.
• Preoperative tests showed acceptable hemoglobin, electrolytes, and coagulation values. Spinal anesthesia was successfully administered.
• A healthy baby was delivered, and the patient maintained normal hemodynamic and biochemical parameters postoperatively without requiring dialysis.
• Pregnancy can exacerbate renal disease, possibly due to increased glomerular perfusion causing injury or microvascular changes.
• Serum creatinine > 2.0 mg/dl carries a 1 in 3 chance of developing end-stage renal disease during or after pregnancy.
• Early and more frequent dialysis is recommended during pregnancy to keep BUN levels controlled.
• Low-dose spinal anesthesia with intrathecal opioids can help preserve renal and uterine blood flow while providing cardiovascular stability.
• Close monitoring for neurological complications is necessary postoperatively, and maintaining intravascular fluid volume is key to preserving renal function.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points:

<summary>
• The study analyzed fortnightly test-day milk yield (FTDMY) data of 733 Karan Fries cows over 12 years to compare lactation curves of normal and mastitis-affected cows using a gamma type function model.
• FTDMY increased until the 3rd-4th fortnight and then declined steadily in both normal and mastitis cows, with mastitis cows having lower peak yields.
• Lactation persistency was higher in 1st parity and declined in subsequent parities for both groups, with mastitis cows showing slightly lower persistency.
• The gamma function model had a high goodness of fit (R² 84-98%) for predicting FTDMY in both normal and mastitis cows across parities.
• Lactation curve parameters like initial yield, ascending slope, and descending slope differed between parities and were slightly affected by mastitis incidence.
• The study confirms the validity of the gamma function model for predicting milk yields in both normal and mastitis-affected cows, which can aid in selection schemes for dairy animals.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
• NDGA extended the median lifespan of male mice by 12% at a dose of 373 mg/kg body weight/day, but higher and lower doses were ineffective. NDGA also increased the lifespan of Drosophila flies by 23%.
• NDGA treatment in mice was associated with an increased incidence of liver, lung, and thymus tumors, as well as hemorrhagic diathesis, although it decreased the size of liver tumors. In humans, NDGA consumption has resulted in toxic hepatitis, cirrhosis, and liver failure.
• Possible mechanisms for NDGA's longevity effects include inhibition of mTORC1 activity, suppression of cancer growth, and hormetic effects. However, NDGA's effects on IGF-1 receptor signaling and inflammation are unlikely to be major mechanisms.
• In flies, NDGA did not affect body weight, physical activity, or food consumption. The data are inconsistent with lifespan extension through inhibition of oxidative phosphorylation.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 7 bullet points:

<summary>
• Biomarkers, including DNA, tumor DNA, and general biomarkers, are important for personalized medicine in diagnosis, treatment selection, and prognosis. Differences exist between the types of biomarkers in terms of stability, complexity, and applications.
• Biomarkers go through a development process involving discovery, assay development and validation, retrospective validation, prospective investigation, and health economics studies. Assay sensitivity is a key requirement.
• Companion diagnostics are predictive biomarkers that identify patients likely to benefit from a treatment, be at risk for adverse reactions, or help monitor treatment response. They require validation with the corresponding therapeutic product.
• Various study designs exist for validating predictive biomarkers and companion diagnostics, including selection designs, interaction designs, and biomarker-guided treatment comparison designs. Adaptive designs can help stop recruitment in biomarker-negative subgroups when futility is determined.
• Reporting quality of biomarker studies has been weak. Following reporting guidelines like STARD, STROBE-ME, REMARK, and PRISMA can improve the quality and readability of biomarker study reports.
• Validating predictive biomarkers should be closely linked to the specific therapy. Conducting trials in ethnically homogeneous populations may help detect biomarker effects if the drug response varies by ethnicity.
• Ease of clinical application, interpretation, and calculation of biomarker results influence their acceptance into routine practice. A priori planning of biomarker research strategies is vital for successful identification and validation.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
* Myosin Va (MyoVa) is a processive molecular motor involved in intracellular cargo transport along actin filaments. Its structure consists of motor domains, lever arms, a coiled-coil rod domain, and a cargo-binding domain.
* Tethered particle microscopy (TPM) was used to directly measure the flexural stiffness of individual MyoVa motors and their subdomains by attaching a quantum dot to the motor and measuring its motion.
* Various MyoVa constructs of different lengths were expressed to isolate the contributions of individual structural domains to the overall flexibility and flexural stiffness of MyoVa.
* Long exposure times were necessary to fully sample the tethered quantum dot's range of motion and accurately estimate MyoVa's flexural stiffness.
* The flexural stiffness of MyoVa's lever arms was estimated to be 0.0346 pN/nm with a corresponding persistence length of 242 nm. Addition of calcium reduced the lever arm stiffness by 40%.
* The distal rod domain of MyoVa was estimated to have a flexural stiffness of 0.0326 pN/nm, suggesting it consists of coiled-coil segments interspersed with highly compliant disordered segments.
* The flexural stiffness for the double-headed MyoVa constructs was an order of magnitude lower than the rod domain and lever arms, indicating the lever arm/rod junction is highly compliant to allow track switching on actin bundles.
* The rigid lever arms allow communication between MyoVa heads for proper gating and processivity, while the compliant lever arm/rod junction provides flexibility to maneuver through the dense actin meshwork.
* Changes in intracellular calcium concentration may regulate MyoVa cargo transport by altering the lever arm stiffness.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points:

<summary>
* This study investigated whether functional polymorphisms in proto-oncogenes and tumor suppressor genes could predict clinical outcome after surgical resection of esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC) or esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC).
* Six SNPs in the AURKA, ERBB2, MDM2, CDH1, CDKN2A, and TP73 genes were genotyped in 346 esophageal cancer patients who underwent surgical resection.
* In multivariate analysis, EAC patients with the heterozygous MDM2 T/G genotype had significantly improved disease-free survival (DFS) compared to those with the wild-type genotype.
* EAC patients with the homozygous CDH1 GA/GA genotype had significantly reduced DFS compared to those with the wild-type genotype.
* The MDM2 T/G and CDH1 GA/GA genotypes were found to confer risk of death in patients with EAC, suggesting germ-line DNA impacts DFS.
* The pattern of disease recurrence showed loco-regional recurrences and distant metastases were common within 2 years after operation.
* The study was limited by the number of polymorphisms investigated and use of mostly FFPE tissue samples rather than blood or fresh frozen samples more suitable for genome-wide association studies.
* Identification of polymorphisms associated with DFS could help detect patients at high or low risk for recurrence and guide treatment decisions.
* Additional prospective studies are needed to validate the associations found and investigate the prognostic significance of these germ-line variants.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points:

<summary>
• Oropharyngeal candidiasis (OPC) is a common opportunistic infection in HIV patients, especially those with CD4+ counts below 200 cells/mm3.
• The study evaluated forms of OPC and their correlation with CD4+ counts in 50 HIV patients over a 2-year period.
• 76% of patients had Candida species isolated from the oral cavity, with C. albicans being the most frequent (92%).
• Pseudomembranous candidiasis was the most common clinical presentation of OPC (52.6%).
• 73% of OPC cases occurred in patients with CD4+ counts < 200 cells/mm3.
• Antiretroviral therapy (ART) reduces the occurrence of OPC in HIV patients.
• Non-albicans Candida species like C. glabrata and C. krusei show decreased susceptibility to fluconazole.
• Continued awareness of OPC as a major clinical sign in the HIV population is necessary.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 2 bullet points:

<summary>
• The 59 nm magnetic nanoparticle tracer performed best for sentinel lymph node biopsy, allowing rapid distribution from the injection site to the sentinel nodes, retention in the first nodes reached, and high accumulation, facilitating intraoperative localization with a handheld magnetometer.
• The 32 nm tracer distributed to higher echelon nodes beyond the sentinel nodes, and the 111 nm tracer took longer for transcutaneous localization, making them less suitable than the 59 nm tracer for sentinel lymph node biopsy.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
* Vaspin and adiponectin are adipokines secreted by adipose tissue that play important roles in obesity, insulin resistance, type 2 diabetes, and cardiovascular disease.
* The study found no significant difference in serum vaspin levels between patients with renal insufficiency and those without, but vaspin levels were lower in patients with type 2 diabetes compared to non-diabetic individuals.
* Serum adiponectin levels were higher in patients with renal insufficiency and type 2 diabetes compared to those without these conditions, and levels were related to age, blood pressure, renal function, and glycemic control.
* Vaspin and adiponectin levels were higher in women than men, and while vaspin was independently associated with HbA1c levels, adiponectin was independently associated with creatinine clearance.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 10 bullet points:

<summary>
• Data from two clinical trials were used to test surrogate variables for neuropathic diabetic foot ulcers (DFUs) and explore correlation between granulation tissue development and complete healing.
• Surrogate markers of complete healing were generated, including percent change in area, log healing rate, and ratio of log areas at 2 weeks and end of treatment (EOT).
• Granulation tissue covering >75% of ulcer area at EOT was the most efficient predictor, with 79.5% correct classification and high negative predictive value.
• Almost 100% of the treatment effect on complete healing may have been mediated by granulation tissue formation.
• Treatment had a significant influence on healing and granulation-dependent variables, but the effect on healing was lost when granulation was incorporated in the model.
• Granulation tissue development has good capacity to discriminate healers from nonhealers and fulfills Prentice criteria for a surrogate endpoint.
• Percent area change, log healing rate, and ratio of log area had predictive capacity for healing in complicated DFUs, but with different cutoff points than for noncomplicated neuropathic lesions.
• Granulation tissue development is proposed as a predictor of wound healing in advanced DFUs for the first time.
• The surrogate markers can be useful for clinical trial design and are easily applicable by clinicians.
• Classifying advanced DFU patients into healers/nonhealers by the 2nd week or EOT based on granulation has implications for new wound healing products and DFU management.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
* The study compared needlescopic transabdominal preperitoneal (NTAPP) and single-incision laparoscopic (STAPP) mesh repair techniques for inguinal hernia in terms of perioperative surgical trauma and postoperative impact on the abdominal wall.
* NTAPP repair resulted in smaller incisions, shorter operative times, reduced immediate postoperative wound pain, and shorter sick leave compared to STAPP repair.
* Long-term outcomes such as hernia recurrence, abdominal wall mobility, and cosmetic satisfaction were comparable between NTAPP and STAPP repairs, but randomized controlled trials are needed to validate the benefits of needlescopic surgery.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 10 bullet points:

<summary>
* Breathing through the nose warms, moistens, and filters air, activating immunological processes that protect the lower airway, while mouth breathing lacks this filtering and immunological activity.
* Mouth breathing in childhood can lead to pathological adaptations of the stomatognathic system structures, affecting facial muscular and skeletal growth.
* Multidisciplinary care is essential for diagnosing, treating, and rehabilitating mouth-breathing children.
* Nasopharyngoscopy is considered the most reliable exam for diagnosing nasopharyngeal obstruction caused by pharyngeal tonsil hyperplasia.
* This study aimed to verify the correlation between nasopharyngoscopy and cephalometry in diagnosing pharyngeal tonsil hyperplasia.
* The study found a regular and positive correlation (r=0.52) between nasopharyngoscopy and cephalometry assessments.
* Cephalometry tended to underestimate the pharyngeal tonsil size compared to nasopharyngoscopy.
* Cephalometry had a sensitivity of 35% and a negative predictive value of 72% compared to nasopharyngoscopy.
* Cephalometry complements nasopharyngoscopy by providing information on facial growth that can be documented and monitored, which is useful for the multidisciplinary care of mouth-breathing patients.
* The study suggests that patients with mouth-breathing symptoms and normal radiography should be referred for nasopharyngoscopy due to its greater diagnostic accuracy.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 10 bullet points:

<summary>
• The incidence of ipsilateral breast tumor relapse (IBTR) in patients treated for breast cancer is less than 6%, but it is important to distinguish between true recurrence (TR) and new primary tumor (NPT).
• A 35-year-old woman was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma (IDC) in the right breast in 2004, treated with surgery, chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and hormone therapy.
• In 2008, she developed inflammatory breast cancer in the same breast, which was HER2-positive and treated with chemotherapy, targeted therapy, and surgery.
• IDC is the most common type of invasive breast cancer, and inflammatory breast cancer is a rare and aggressive form.
• After breast-conserving treatment, IBTR can represent TR or NPT, which have different prognoses and treatment implications.
• The risk of a second breast cancer depends on estrogen receptor status, time of diagnosis, and family history.
• NPT is designated based on distinct histology, change from more to less invasive cancer, location, and genetic profile.
• Salvage mastectomy is the standard treatment for IBTR, but the optimal systemic therapy is unknown.
• TR has a poor prognosis and may benefit from aggressive adjuvant treatment, while NPT has a more favorable prognosis and is treated similarly to de novo breast cancer.
• Breast cancer survivorship care requires understanding relapse patterns and establishing appropriate follow-up and screening.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 7 bullet points:

<summary>
* Age-related macular degeneration (AMD) is a leading cause of severe vision loss in older adults, with the neovascular form accounting for most cases of severe central vision loss. Anti-VEGF treatments like ranibizumab and aflibercept have transformed the management of neovascular AMD.
* Visual acuity (VA) and contrast sensitivity (CS) are important independent measures of visual function. CS testing can detect subtle vision changes that may be concealed by VA testing alone.
* This study evaluated the change in CS, VA, central retinal thickness (CRT), and vision-related quality of life in patients with recalcitrant neovascular AMD who were switched from ranibizumab to aflibercept treatment.
* After 12 weeks, there was a statistically significant improvement in CS and decrease in CRT, while VA remained stable. Two-thirds of patients had an improvement in vision-related quality of life scores.
* The results suggest that CS may provide additional information about visual impairment and treatment response beyond VA alone in neovascular AMD patients, especially those who are switched to aflibercept after suboptimal response to ranibizumab.
* Switching anti-VEGF agents can be a viable strategy for improving outcomes in patients with recalcitrant neovascular AMD. Most retina specialists consider switching reasonable after an inadequate response to 3-6 initial injections.
* Further research with larger patient populations and longer follow-up is warranted to validate these findings and explore the utility of CS and other measures of visual function in AMD and other retinal diseases.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 5 bullet points:

<summary>
• This case-control study evaluated the association between the c424c/a polymorphism within the IL-25 gene and multiple sclerosis (MS) in an Iranian population.
• 74 patients with relapse and remitting MS and 75 healthy controls were enrolled; DNA was purified from peripheral blood immune cells.
• The frequency distribution of the AA, AC and CC genotypes was not statistically different between MS patients and controls.
• The frequencies of the A and C alleles were also not significantly different between the two groups.
• The results suggest that the c424c/a polymorphism within the IL-25 gene is not associated with MS and cannot be considered a risk factor for MS development.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
* The prevalence of thoracic aortic aneurysm (TAA) was high (36.5%) and more common than abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) (6.0%) in elderly Korean males with hypertension and multiple risk factors for coronary heart disease and aortic aneurysm.
* TAA was independently associated with older age, larger body surface area, higher diastolic blood pressure, and absence of dyslipidemia, while AAA was associated with dyslipidemia, smoking history, and presence of TAA.
* The study had limitations in evaluating the aortic root and the results may not apply to females, other ethnicities, or low-risk groups, suggesting a need for distinct TAA and AAA screening strategies based on risk factors and ethnicity.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points:

<summary>
